meaningMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
readingMnemonic: Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you to remember: For as long as you can remember, your family and another family has had a bloody <reading>feud</reading> (ふで) over this one <vocabulary>writing brush</vocabulary>. Just think of all the people killed over this brush. This feud has to end.
